description:

AC: PR of script in feature branch, screenshot of endpoint created with script

summary: Monthly Status Report
description:
Value Statement: As a team lead, I need to produce monthly deliverables to satisfy VA requirements and ensure communication on team updates.

Working with other leads, we will ensure these deliverables are submitted by the expected due dates.

description:
Value Statement: As a team lead, I need to produce biweekly reports to satisfy VA requirements and ensure communication on team updates.

Working with other leads, we will ensure these reports are submitted by the expected due dates.

summary: Monthly Deliverables
description:
Value Statement: As a team lead, I need to produce monthly status reports to satisfy VA requirements and ensure communication on team updates.

Working with other leads, we will ensure these reports are submitted by the expected due dates.

summary: Determine architecture pattern for ARIA strands orchestration
description:
Value Statement: As an engineer I need to research and document the way we will use strands in ARIA.

AC: Confluence document with strands orchestration.

summary: Limit token input and output responses for ARIA
description:
Value Statement: As an ARIA user I need a limit on the amount of tokens that can be inputted and outputted into the model.

AC: Input tokens limited on front and backend Output token limit passed as a parameter to requests to bedrock.

summary: Parse logs for ARIA specific Bedrock logging metrics
description:
Value Statement: As an engineer I want to parse the logs coming from ARIA so we can begin managing usage and other metrics for a dashboard.

AC: Grafana dashboard with different logs parsed so metrics can be created later.

summary: Create Harness Service for AWS Lambda Deployments
description:
Value Statement: As a DevOps Engineer I want to create a templatized Harness Service for deploying AWS Lambda functions So that I can automate and manage Lambda deployments consistently across environments.

AC: - Harness AWS connector is configured with sufficient Lambda permissions. - Artifact connectors (S3 or ECR) are created for Lambda deployment package or image. - A new Harness Service is defined for AWS Lambda, specifying deployment type and relevant configuration. - Service variables are established for function name, handler, runtime, memory, timeout, role ARN, and artifact details. - Environment and Infrastructure definitions for AWS region are set up. - Pipeline Deploy stage is configured to use the Service and Environment, with runtime inputs for artifact/version.

summary: Build Docker Image for Automated Testing Pipelines
description:
Value Statement: As a bip ai engineer, I want a Docker image preconfigured with Python, Playwright, all required browser drivers, and VA certificates so that I can reliably run automated tests in a consistent environment and retrieve the image from Nexus for use in CI/CD pipelines.

AC: - A Dockerfile is created that installs: - Python (specific version as required) - Playwright and its dependencies - Supported browser drivers (Chromium, Firefox, WebKit) - VA certificates required for the test environment - The Docker image builds successfully and passes a health check (e.g., Python and Playwright are available, browsers launch, certificates are accessible). - The image is tagged appropriately (e.g., `automated-testing-playwright:latest`) and pushed to the designated Nexus repository.

summary: MLkit Jupyter Lab Image deploy step
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI Engineer who builds custom images, I need the ability to automatically attach custom images (most likely using Harness) so that my workflow is less error-prone (like when using AWS CLI).

AC: A user can go into Harness, specify their GitHub repo, branch, Dockerfile path etc (similar to the current image-builder job), and not only be able to push to ECR (which we already have), but also attach the image to Sagemaker Studio domains (most likely thru AWS CLI commands in a Dockerfile), and be able to select it in the Image dropdown when starting up a space Also, mlkit custom image is attached to all domains.

summary: Develop Implementation Plan for Image Signing in Build Pipelines
description:
Value Statement: As a DevSecOps engineer, I want to develop an implementation plan for adding image signing procedures to our container image build pipelines in harness, based on the Platform Zero Trust policy, so that our images are securely signed and compliant with security requirements. I want to develop an implementation plan for adding image signing procedures to our container image build pipelines, based on the Platform Zero Trust policy, so that our images are securely signed and compliant with security requirements.

AC: - Identify integration points and required changes to current build pipelines for image signing. - Select appropriate image signing tools and methods (e.g., cosign, Notary, etc.) in line with Zero Trust recommendations. - Draft a step-by-step implementation plan including prerequisites, configuration, and automation steps. - Document plan in the repo and share it with relevant stakeholders. - Include security validation steps and ongoing compliance checks. - Identify integration points and required changes to current build pipelines for image signing. - Select appropriate image signing tools and methods (e.g., cosign, Notary, etc.) in line with Zero Trust recommendations. - Draft a step-by-step implementation plan including prerequisites, configuration, and automation steps. - Document plan in the repo and share it with relevant stakeholders. - Include security validation steps and ongoing compliance checks.

summary: SageMaker Processing Jobs Pipeline
description:
Title: SageMaker Processing Jobs Harness PipelineNew

Value Statement: As a BIP AI engineer, I want to create a working Harness pipeline for deploying SageMaker processing jobs. This pipeline will be later templatized so that teams can use it to deploy any SageMaker processing jobNew

AC: C: Harness pipeline is created to automate deployment of SageMaker processing jobs. TPipeline is tested and validated for at least one real deployment scenario.

summary: Enable sbx delegates in harness mgmt
description:
Value Statement: As a bip ai engineer, I want to enable the SBX delegates within the Harness management instance so that sandbox environments are able to execute workflows and pipelines securely and reliably using delegated resources.

AC: - SBX delegates are registered and enabled within the Harness management instance. - Delegates are configured with proper permissions and connectivity to required environments. - Documentation is updated to include steps for enabling, registering, and troubleshooting SBX delegates. - Validation is performed by running sample workflows/pipelines using the SBX delegates in the sandbox environment. - Any issues, errors, or limitations encountered during enablement are documented and communicated to stakeholders.

summary: Build docker image for Load Test Pipeline
description:
Value Statement: As a bip ai engineer, I want a Docker image preconfigured with Python, VA certificates, and all necessary dependencies for running Locust load tests, so that I can reliably execute load tests using the Locust CLI and retrieve the image from Nexus for use in automated harness pipelines.

AC: - A Dockerfile is created that installs: - Python (specific version as required) - Locust CLI and its dependencies - VA certificates required for the test environment - The Docker image builds successfully and passes a health check (e.g., Locust CLI launches, certificates are accessible). - The image is tagged appropriately (e.g., `locust-cli:latest`) and pushed to the designated Nexus repository.

summary: Explore Harness IRSA ServiceAccount to Stage Namespace Status
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI engineer, I want to explore the status of the Kubernetes ServiceAccount for Harness IRSA to the stage namespace, so that Harness jobs in the stage environment can use IRSA securely and consistently.

Acceptance Criteria: - A Kubernetes ServiceAccount manifest is created and named using the convention `stage-bip-ai-{*}`.{*} - The ServiceAccount is deployed to the stage namespace and references the Harness IRSA role using the `eks.amazonaws.com/role-arn` annotation. - The deployment is validated by confirming that Harness jobs in the stage namespace can assume the IRSA role and perform required actions. - Documentation is updated to include steps for deploying and validating the ServiceAccount in the stage environment.

Additional Context: - This is a follow-up to adapting the Crossplane composition for Harness IRSA roles. - Reference implementation: [foundation-cicd-support-composition.yaml]

summary: Fix cookie cutter repo CI Github actions and update tenant repos
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP MLOps engineer, Tenants require the ability to use the cookie cutter template which incorporates github actions for linting, testing on push Description: The github actions in the cookie cutter do not work currently, they need to be fixed and improved then applied to tenant repos.

Acceptance Criteria: - PR for cookie cutter template mlops-template repo.

summary: Explore IaC for deploying assets in Grafana
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI team member who manages and maintains Grafana monitoring assets, I need the ability to define and deploy Grafana dashboards and alerts using IaC) so that we can achieve consistent, automated, and version-controlled deployments across environments.

Acceptance Criteria: -When the exploration is complete, a Confluence document is created detailing the IaC options, integration feasibility, and an action plan for implementing automated Grafana asset deployment. -When evaluating tools, the team collaborates with the BIP-AI infrastructure team to identify appropriate IaC solutions -When the POC or findings are reviewed, the BIP-AI team approves next steps, and the documentation is linked in the monitoring and automation reference materials.

summary: Create SOP for tenants on how to work with aggregating metrics in Grafana
description:
Value Statement: As a tenant user who builds dashboards and visualizes metrics in Grafana, I need the ability to reference a clear SOP on aggregating metrics and designing effective panels so that I can produce accurate, performant, and consistent dashboards aligned with BIP-AI monitoring standards.

Acceptance Criteria: - When a tenant accesses the SOP in Confluence, the document clearly explains how to aggregate metrics (e.g., sum, avg, max) and apply best practices for panel creation and performance optimization. - When the SOP draft is complete, it is reviewed and approved by the BIP-AI team to ensure alignment with monitoring and dashboarding standards. - When the SOP is published, Confluence documentation is updated and version-controlled, and references are added to the tenant onboarding or monitoring documentation set.

summary: Create alerts for tenants in dev referencing quota limits where applicable
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI team member who monitors tenant activity and resource usage in the development environment, I need the ability to create Grafana alerts for tenants in dev that reference applicable AWS service quota limits so that we can proactively identify and address potential overages before they impact system performance or tenant operations.

Acceptance Criteria: When a tenant’s resource usage approaches or exceeds applicable AWS service quota thresholds, the Grafana alert triggers a notification to the nonprod Slack channel. - When quota information is unclear or outdated, the team collaborates with solution engineers to confirm applicable limits before finalizing alerts. - When alerts are implemented, they are validated through simulated over-quota conditions, and documentation is updated for alerting configuration reference.

summary: Attach dev and stable LCCs to all domains and remove all others
description:
Value Statement: As an MLE creating and maintaining MLKit, I want to attach the dev and stable LCCs to all domains and remove unused LCCs so that tenants only have one LCC to choose from.

AC: LCCs tested and pushed to all domains, all other LCCs removed from tenant domains.

summary: Incorporate any functional code in bedrock tutorials into RAF
description:
{*}Title{*}: Incorporate knowledge base code in bedrock tutorials in RAF
*Value Statement:*
 As an MLOps engineer who integrates Bedrock functionality into shared frameworks, I need to incorporate the Bedrock knowledge-base capabilities from our tutorial notebooks into the RAF GenAI module so that all tenants can use a unified interface for Bedrock knowledge-base operations.
*Acceptance Criteria:* * Integrate reusable Bedrock knowledge-base logic into the RAF GenAI module, following existing structure, naming conventions, and coding standards.
 * Update knowledge base tutorial in tenant resources with updated GenAI module
 * Add or update tests to validate tenant scoping, correctness of functionality, and compatibility with existing RAF modules and Bedrock tutorials.
 * Update RAF documentation and examples to describe usage, configuration, and migration from the tutorial notebooks to the RAF implementation.

summary: Create example notebook for strands bedrock Knowledge Base integration
description:
Value Statement: As an MLE expanding the use cases for strands agents, I want to create a strands agent that uses a bedrock knowledge base as a tool so I can add to the mlkit strands agent functionality.

AC: Add KB tool use to existing MLKit strands agent example notebook. Agent should be able to query from an existing bedrock knowledge base.

summary: Create documentation on strands multi-agent patterns and when to use each
description:
Value Statement: As an MLE building out agentic capabilities with Strands, I want to do research and document the findings on multi-agent patterns so I can implement the correct pattern for each use case.

AC: Documentation in confluence describing each type of multi agent orchestration workflows, and example use cases for each one

summary: Migrate XRD and resource management routes to Go to support primary UI functionality
description:
**Value Statement:** As a frontend developer, I want the primary XRD listing, resource viewing, and pause/unpause functionality migrated to Go so that the existing Vue.js frontend continues to work without modification.

**Dependencies:** - Story 1: Core API Foundation Migration must be completed

**Acceptance Criteria:** - Given a request to /xrds when authenticated then it returns all XRDs in the same JSON format as Python API - Given a request to /xrds/\{name} when authenticated then it returns the specific XRD details matching Python API response - Given a request to /xrds/\{name}/claims when authenticated then it returns all claims for that XRD - Given a request to /list-all-cached-resources when admin authenticated then it returns all cached resources - Given a request to /list-paused-resources when authenticated then it returns all paused resources in the same format - Given a POST to /pause-resource with valid payload when admin authenticated then it successfully pauses or resumes the resource - Given any XRD route request when processed then tenant access controls are properly enforced - Given the existing Vue.js frontend when pointed to the Go API then all primary views load and function correctly

**Definition of Done:** - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit + integration) - Documentation updated (README / API docs) - XRD service layer implemented with caching - Resource pause/unpause functionality fully migrated - Admin access controls implemented and tested - Vue.js frontend compatibility validated - Performance benchmarks show improvement over Python API

summary: Implement core Crossplane Resource Manager foundation in Go to enable local MVP testing
description:
**Value Statement:** As a platform engineer, I want the core API foundation migrated from Python to Go so that I can test basic functionality locally and validate the performance improvements.

**Assumptions:** - Current Go project structure in bip-crossplane-manager will be the foundation - Local testing environment can be established with existing Kubernetes access - Core routes include /, /config, /health, and basic authentication middleware.

**Acceptance Criteria:** - Given the Go API server when I start it locally then it responds to health checks - Given a request to the root endpoint when authenticated then it returns API metadata including version and environment - Given a request to /config when authenticated then it returns the same configuration format as the Python API - Given any authenticated request when processed then user authentication works via existing OAuth2 proxy headers - Given the core middleware when implemented then CORS, logging, and authentication are properly handled - Given the basic route structure when established then it follows the documented pattern in STRUCTURE.md - Given the Kubernetes client integration when tested then it can successfully connect to the cluster.

**Definition of Done:** - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit + integration) - Documentation updated in README - Local development environment setup documented - Authentication middleware tested with sample requests - Basic route structure established per STRUCTURE.md / ROUTES.md - Go modules and dependencies properly configured.

summary: Tracking Bedrock Provider Approval
description:
Value Statement: As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to track and support the deployment of our custom Bedrock Provider across the environments.

A/C:: Track and support BIP System team in the deployment that contains the custom Bedrock Provider.

description:

A/C: Setup github actions pipeline to perform linting, unit testing, and build of our custom Bedrock Provider.

summary: Deny Bedrock Prod resource edits from preprod domains to improve security
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI infra engineer who designs tenant IAM policies, I need the ability to update permission policy to certain tenant policies so that tenants cannot update bedrock prod resources from their preprod tenant execution role.

Acceptance Criteria:

1 . Add deny policy for bedrock resources with "Environment" tag equals to "prod".

2. Add deny policy to prod lambda function edit to execution role.

summary: Create Accelerator Cookie Cutter Python API template
description:
Value Statement: As a BIH user who provision an python api (fastapi), I need the ability to quickly generate standardized Python API project so that development time is reduced and so that projects follow consistent standards.

Acceptance Criteria: When a user runs the cookiecutter template, the user has the ability to see that the cookie cutter template for the fast api app is created. Test cookiecutter template generation.

summary: Research confluent and apache flink
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI engineer, I want to research Confluent Apache Flink and meet with experts to understand how AI can accelerate workflows.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Meet with Apache Flink team members 
- Document findings and plan for Flink

summary: Setup SM Pipeline using template for each step needed in ingestion pipeline
description:
Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer and the SE for the SCC team, I want to build a modular SageMaker Pipeline composed of reusable templates for each ingestion step (scraping M21, parsing/reformatting, updating the Knowledge Base) so that new sources can be onboarded rapidly, runs are repeatable/observable, and failures are recoverable with minimal operator effort.

SageMaker Pipeline definition with three steps: - Scrape M21 site (fetch pages, store raw HTML/text to S3). - Parse & Reformat (convert to clean text/JSON with metadata: title, URL, timestamp, section headings, checksum; write to curated S3 prefix). - Update Knowledge Base (load curated docs into KB index; upsert by document ID/checksum; maintain ingestion log).

Acceptance Criteria:

AC1 – Pipeline creation

AC2 – Step templates

AC3 – Scrape step output

AC4 – Parse & Reformat output

AC5 – Knowledge Base update

summary: Update Grafana queries + metrics for Gen Ann
description:
Value Statement: As a member of the Gen-Ann tenant team, I want to use Grafana to monitor desired metrics for the Gen-Ann App. There are certain queries and metrics in the Grafana dashboard that are unclear or can be improved. They should be updated.

Acceptance Critera: -Review queries and clarify difference between DailyHighlights and BedrockInvocationCount - Find the correct query design that allows tracking of Cost Metrics by monthly timeline - Provide Query-Metric mapping from Lambda - Update transformation functions such that date information can be rendered in the desired format.

summary: Investigate how to install oracle in thick mode for lambda layers for Gen Ann
description:
Value Statement: As an SE supporting GenAnn, I want to enable the thick mode oracle library in their lambda layers, so they can read and write to the VBMS database using a lambda.

AC: GenAnn lambdas have read/write permissions to VBMS Oracle DB.

summary: Load testing measuring latency with TERA endpoints
description:

AC: Measuring load testing performance of endpoints including latency - Testing the endpoints for long periods of time with breaks between requests to more accurately measure the cool down period observed.

summary: Add built-in testing, pylint and black for SPA CI
description:
Value Statement: As an SPA developer who commits and reviews code, I need the ability to automatically run unit tests, pylint, and black in CI so that defects and style issues are caught early, code stays consistent, and merges remain reliable.

Acceptance Criteria: - When a user opens a PR to main or pushes to any branch, the CI pipeline runs three distinct stages: Tests, Lint, and Format-check. ----Tests: ------Executes pytest with a coverage report. ------Lint (pylint) ------Pipeline fails if any files are not properly formatted.

summary: Clean SPA Agentic repo cleaning--remove and/or archive un-used work
description: Value Statement: As a solution engineer maintaining the SPA Agentic codebase, I need the ability to identify, remove, or archive unused or deprecated work so that the repository remains clean, relevant, and maintainable for future development cycles. Acceptance Criteria: - When a user reviews the SPA Agentic repository, they can clearly identify which components are active and which have been archived. -Unused or deprecated files, directories, and notebooks are either: -----Removed if confirmed obsolete, ------or ------Archived to a designated /archive folder - Documentation and README files reflect the current active components and reference the archived location of old work. -CI/CD or build pipelines confirm no broken imports or references after cleanup.

summary: Lambda Deployment Harness Template
description:
As a BIP AI  engineer, I want to create a highly templatized Harness piepline for deploying lambda functions based on the existing lambda deployment pipeline, so that teams can quickly reuse and adapt the pipeline for different lambda functions using input sets.

AC: 
The pipeline is modular and templatized, allowing easy customization and reuse.
The pipeline is saved as a Harness template and documented for other users to pull and use.
The template supports parameterization for common deployment variables.
Pipeline is tested and validated for at least one real deployment scenario.

summary: Resolve Permission Issue When Validating Test in Bedrock Data Automation project
description:
Value Statement:
As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who is using Bedrock Data Automation to create a project with a custom blueprint, I need work with INFRA team to resolve a permission issue when trying to validate a test to ensure that all required fields are processed from a sample PDF file.
Acceptance Criteria:
Successfully validated a test to ensure that all required fields are processed from a sample PDF file.

summary: Configure ECR connector with static Harness secrets
description:
Value Statement:

As a BIP AI engineer, I need the ECR connector configured to use static Harness secrets instead of Vault so that the image promotion pipeline executes reliably without intermittent authentication failures caused by Vault connectivity issues.

Acceptance Criteria:
•     ECR credential secrets created in Harness for all environments (dev, stage, preprod, prod)
•     bip-tenant-config updated with static secret references for ECR connector
•     Configuration changes merged and synced via ArgoCD
•     Image promotion pipeline executes 5 consecutive times without Vault timeout errors
•     Documentation updated with configuration details

summary: Identify restructuring needs for SPA Agentic solution to improve maintainability and deployment alignment
description:
Value Statement:
As a Solution Engineer supporting the SPA Agentic framework, I need the ability to identify components of the current implementation that require restructuring so that the codebase, configuration, and infrastructure can be streamlined for maintainability, scalability, and alignment with BIP AI's broader deployment standards.


Acceptance Criteria:
Review of the SPA Agentic solution performed, and a comprehensive list of restructuring targets (e.g., modules, dependencies, folder structure, scripts, configs) is produced.
Redundant or legacy elements that can be removed, areas requiring consolidation or refactoring, identified.

- Disclaimer added to welcome message telling users not to put PII/PHI and that all answers might not be correct and for them to double-check with sources.

Acceptance Criteria:

summary: Create EVA Lambdas with IAC in dev, stage, and preprod to automate resource management

summary: Troubleshoot BIP-AI and tenant Crossplane resources affected by DEV cluster outage to restore domain access and healthy status
description:
As a BIP-AI Infra engineer, I need to recover resources and application deployments that are failing after the DEV cluster outage.A/C: * All BIP-AI and tenant Crossplane resources healthy/synced
 * BIP-AI Gateway pods deploy successfully with access to REDIS cache
 * AI Gateway front-end accessible and functioning normal
 * Tenant MLFlow instances reachable/functioning
